gov.sandia.cognition.graph.community

Class PersonalizedPageRank<NodeNameType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.graph.community.PersonalizedPageRank<NodeNameType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeNameType - The graph's node name type

    @PublicationReference(type=WebPage,
                      title="Personalized PageRank code",
                      author="dgleich",
                      year=2016,
                      url="https://gist.github.com/dgleich/6201856")
public class PersonalizedPageRank<NodeNameType>
extends java.lang.Object
    This class can compute PersonalizedPageRank for the input graph and a specified node, and also can determine a community for any specified node. The code permits multiple queries against the same graph, storing the necessary speed-up objects as part of the instance.
    Author:
    jdwendt

    • Constructor Detail

      • PersonalizedPageRank

        public PersonalizedPageRank(DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType> graph)
        Initializes all of the internal data-structures for the input graph. Note that if the input graph is altered after passing it to this class, the results for this instance can become unstable.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to compute personalized page rank for

      • PersonalizedPageRank

        public PersonalizedPageRank(DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType> graph,
                            double tolerance)
        Initializes all of the internal data-structures for the input graph. Note that if the input graph is altered after passing it to this class, the results for this instance can become unstable.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to compute personalized page rank for
        tolerance - The tolerance for further spreading PPR. Should be fairly small 0.01 or smaller. The closer to 0, the further it will spread. Setting to 0 could lead to never quite converging (so probably don't do that).

    • Method Detail

      • setTolerance

        public void setTolerance(double tolerance)
        Set the tolerance to a new value. Should be small (0, 0.01]. The closer to 0, the further it will spread. Setting to 0 could lead to never quite converging (so probably don't do that).
        Parameters:
        tolerance - The tolerance for further spreading PPR.

        public void setRandomSet(long seed)

        Parameters:
        seed - The seed for the random number generator

      • getScoresForAllNodes

        public DoubleArrayList getScoresForAllNodes(NodeNameType node,
                                            boolean randomized)
        Returns the vector of all scores for all nodes in the graph (order determined by node order as stored in the graph)
        Parameters:
        node - The node to use as seed
        randomized - If true, the order nodes are treated within the algorithm will be randomized so that you can get an average result across multiple runs or just realize that any single run is not the completely true answer.
        Returns:
        the vector of all scores for all nodes in the graph

      • getScoresForAllNodesMultirun

        public DoubleArrayList getScoresForAllNodesMultirun(NodeNameType node,
                                                    int numRuns)
        Returns the vector of all scores for all nodes in the graph (order determined by node order as stored in the graph) as specified for the input seed. This implementation uses the random version and averages over numRuns random runs.
        Parameters:
        node - The seed node to consider
        numRuns - The number of runs to perform
        Returns:
        the vector of all scores for all nodes in the graph

      • getScoresForAllNodesMultirun

        Parameters:
        nodes - The seed nodes
        numRuns - The number of runs to perform
        Returns:

      • getCommunityForNode

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getCommunityForNode(NodeNameType node,
                                                            int numRunsPpr,
                                                            int numRunsCut)
        Computes the best community for the input node id by personalized page rank scores and conductance of cut. Note both the PPR computation and the community-via-conducntance computation contain order-dependence. Therefore, this code always uses a random ordering. For PPR, it returns the average PPR across all of the runs. For the community determination, it returns the community with the best conductance based as found by following edges in different orders.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose community is desired
        numRunsPpr - The number of randomized runs to perform for the PPR computation
        numRunsCut - The number of randomized runs to perform for community determination
        Returns:

      • getCommunityForNodeById

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getCommunityForNodeById(int nodeIdx,
                                                                int numRunsPpr,
                                                                int numRunsCut)
        Computes the best community for the input node id by personalized page rank scores and conductance of cut. Note both the PPR computation and the community-via-conducntance computation contain order-dependence. Therefore, this code always uses a random ordering. For PPR, it returns the average PPR across all of the runs. For the community determination, it returns the community with the best conductance based as found by following edges in different orders.
        Parameters:
        nodeIdx - The node id whose community is desired
        numRunsPpr - The number of randomized runs to perform for the PPR computation
        numRunsCut - The number of randomized runs to perform for community determination
        Returns:

      • getCommunityForNodes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getCommunityForNodes(java.util.List<NodeNameType> nodes,
                                                             int numRunsPpr,
                                                             int numRunsCut)
        Computes the best community for the input node id by personalized page rank scores and conductance of cut. Note both the PPR computation and the community-via-conducntance computation contain order-dependence. Therefore, this code always uses a random ordering. For PPR, it returns the average PPR across all of the runs. For the community determination, it returns the community with the best conductance based as found by following edges in different orders.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The node(s) whose community is desired
        numRunsPpr - The number of randomized runs to perform for the PPR computation
        numRunsCut - The number of randomized runs to perform for community determination
        Returns:

      • getCommunityForNodesById

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> getCommunityForNodesById(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> nodeIdxs,
                                                                 int numRunsPpr,
                                                                 int numRunsCut)
        Computes the best community for the input node id by personalized page rank scores and conductance of cut. Note both the PPR computation and the community-via-conducntance computation contain order-dependence. Therefore, this code always uses a random ordering. For PPR, it returns the average PPR across all of the runs. For the community determination, it returns the community with the best conductance based as found by following edges in different orders.
        Parameters:
        nodeIdxs - The node id(s) whose community is desired
        numRunsPpr - The number of randomized runs to perform for the PPR computation
        numRunsCut - The number of randomized runs to perform for community determination
        Returns:
